answers.answer: I have not been in your situation so I don't know what you're going through. My only advice would be to take it one day at a time.  Sounds like you have a goid team really looking out for you and your baby. Ask add many questions as you need and want. That what your team is there for. Lots of babies are born in this situation and are okay. Just take it easy mama and wishing you the best!

question: I usually do not post from age group to age group but I have an urgent question. Hi ladies I have been in the hospital for 8 weeks now. I got a cerclage aat 19 weeks and my cervix is 1cm sometimes shorter. I was diagnosed with gestational diabetes weeks ago. My blood pressure wstarted going up 2 weeks ago, I did all the blood test and they are normal. Yesterday I did the 24 hours urine collection and protein was found in my urine. I was told today that the perinatal doctors will come talk to me about when to have the baby. Am currently 31 weeks and 3 days. Is there any one that has been in this situation? What was the outcome? Is my baby going to be fine am worried.
title: gestational diabetes and now preeclamsia. what do I need to know
